recipes.name: Cheesy Chile Relleno Casserole
recipes.description: Chile Relleno Casserole is full of whole green chiles, a fluffy egg batter, and lots of cheesy goodness. It's an easy breakfast with flavors the entire family will love!
instructions: 1. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees.
2. Slice Colby Jack cheese into even pieces.
3. Place a layer of 6 whole green chiles on the bottom of a greased 9×13 baking dish.
4. Top the chiles with a layer of the cheese slices. Then add 6 more chiles on top of the cheese slices and finish with the remaining cheese.
5. Beat together eggs, flour, and evaporated milk. Pour the mixture over the layers of cheese and chiles.
6. Cover the pan with foil and bake for 25 minutes at 350 degrees.
7. Remove the pan from the oven and pour tomato sauce evenly over the top of the casserole.
8. Return to the oven uncovered to bake for another 20-25 minutes.
9. Allow the casserole to rest for 5 minutes to firm up, then serve.
substitutions: Banana Peppers, Poblano Pepper, Bell Pepper, Jalapeno Pepper for Green Chiles
Tomato paste (1 part paste to 1 part water), canned tomatoes (1:1), tomato soup (remove 1/4 cup liquid for every 10.75 ounce can), spaghetti sauce (1:1) for tomato sauce
Powdered milk (mix 1 1/2 cups with 1 1/4 cups water), half and half (1:1), dairy free milks (1:1) for evaporated milk

Mashed/pureed avocado (1/4 cup per egg), commercial egg replacements (follow package instructions), pureed silken tofu (1/4 cup per egg), baking soda (1 teaspoon) and vinegar (1 tablespoon), plain yogurt (1/4 cup) for eggs
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Banana Smoothie with Ice
recipes.description: This Banana Smoothie with ice features fresh or frozen bananas, creamy yogurt, and sweet brown sugar. It's a tasty and refreshing drink for your breakfast or brunch!
ingredients: 2 ripe medium bananas, broken in pieces
instructions: 1. Crush 4-5 ice cubes in a blender.
2. Add yogurt, bananas, brown sugar, milk, and vanilla to the blender, cover, and blend on high until well combined.
3. Pour into glasses and finish with a ground nutmeg.
substitutions: Honey (1/2 cup) for brown sugar
Ice cream (2 scoops) and milk (for thinning to desired consistency) for yogurt
Add peanut butter and oats for more protein.
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Fluffy Blueberry Muffins from Scratch
recipes.description: You’ll never go back to box mixes once you try these fluffy blueberry muffins. They’re homemade, only 8 ingredients, and made completely from scratch!
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
2. Cream butter and sugar together with an electric mixer until combined.
3. Add eggs to the sugar mixture one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. Sift together flour, salt, and baking powder in a medium mixing bowl.
5. Add the flour mixture and milk to the sugar mixture a little at a time, alternating between the flour and the milk. Mix until just combined.
6. Gently fold in blueberries.
7. Add 1/4 cup of batter to a muffin tin with liners. Bake the muffins at 375 degrees for 24-26 minutes, or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
8. Carefully remove muffins from the tin and place on baking rack. Allow muffins to cool for 5 minutes before eating.
substitutions: Ghee (1:1); coconut oil (1:1), olive oil (3/4 of the amount of called for butter), margarine (1:1), pureed banana, avocado, pumpkin (1:1), applesauce (1:1) for butter

Pureed avocado, banana, pumpkin (1/4 cup per egg), apple sauce (1:1), commercial egg replacements (follow package instructions), pureed silken tofu (1/4 cup per egg), baking soda (1 teaspoon) and vinegar (1 tablespoon), plain yogurt (1/4 cup) for eggs
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Easy German Oven Pancakes
recipes.description: German Oven Pancakes feature a vanilla cinnamon batter that’s baked in a buttered dish and puffs while in the oven. It’s a delicious twist on the traditional pancake!
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
2. Add butter to a 9 x 13 baking dish and then place dish in the oven to melt the butter. Remove the pan as soon as the butter has melted.
3. While the butter is melting, blend eggs, milk, flour, salt, cinnamon, and vanilla in a blender until well combined.
4. Carefully pour the batter into the buttered pan.
5. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
substitutions: Ghee (1:1); coconut oil (1:1), olive oil (3/4 of the amount of called for butter), margarine (1:1), pureed banana, avocado, pumpkin (1:1), applesauce (1:1) for butter
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: The Easiest Braided Raspberry Pastry
recipes.description: This braided Raspberry Pastry features sweet jam, a sugar glaze, and a pancake mix pastry. It’s a delicious breakfast treat without all of the fuss of traditional dough.
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees and grease a half sheet pan or line with parchment paper.
2. In a large bowl, cut cream cheese and cold butter into pancake mix with a pastry cutter (or sturdy fork) until the mixture resembles crumbs.
3. Add 1/4 cup milk to the dry mixture (or enough to make a dough). Mix the dough with a wooden spoon or your hands until well combined.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until smooth (about 2-3 minutes) and roll out to a rectangle the size of the pan. Carefully transfer the dough to the greased baking sheet.
5. Spread the jam down the center of the pastry and cut 11-13 thin diagonal strips on the bare pastry with a paring knife.
6. Fold the pieces over the jam and each other alternating sides and starting at the top.
7. Bake for 12-15 minutes at 425 degrees until the pastry is golden brown and jam is bubbling.
8. While the pastry is baking, whisk together powdered sugar, 1 tablespoon milk, and vanilla in a small bowl. Remove the pastry from the oven and allow it to cool for 5 minutes.
9. Drizzle the glaze onto the warm pastry with the whisk.
substitutions: Bisquick (1:1) for pancake mix
Margarine (1:1) for butter
Any other flavor jam (1:1) for raspberry jam
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: 4-Ingredient Pumpkin Pancakes With Pancake Mix
recipes.description: You’ll only need 4 ingredients to make these light and fluffy Pumpkin Pancakes with Pancake Mix. They taste like fall and your kids will love the bright orange color!
instructions: 1. In a medium bowl, whisk all ingredients until just blended. Do not over mix; batter should be lumpy.
2. Heat griddle over medium-low heat. Once heated spray with cooking spray or butter.
3. Pour pancake batter onto the griddle using 1/2 cup measuring cup or ladle.
4. Cook for 2 minutes or until bubbles appear.
5. Turn pancakes over and cook for 2 minutes longer or until the other side is done.
substitutions: Cinnamon (1 1/2 teaspoons) and ginger (1/2 teaspoon) for pumpkin pie spice
Bisquick (1:1) for pancake mix
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Healthy Crustless Broccoli and Ham Quiche
recipes.description: This Crustless Broccoli and Ham Quiche features a delicious egg filling and is topped with melty cheese. It’s low-carb and a healthy option for your breakfast or brunch.
ingredients: 1 cup ham, cooked and cubed into small pieces
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
2. Saute the ham pieces and onion in a small frying pan until the ham and onions have browned.
3. Combine mayonnaise, flour, eggs, and milk in a medium bowl. Mix well.
4. Place broccoli, ham, onion, and half the cheese in the bottom of a greased 9-inch pie dish. Pour the egg mixture on top.
5. Sprinkle the rest of the cheese evenly over the quiche.
6. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-45 minutes, until the center is almost set (slightly jiggly). Allow to cool for 15 minutes before serving.
substitutions: Half and half (1:1), evaporated milk (1:1) for milk
Low-fat mayonnaise (1:1), Greek yogurt (1:1), egg (1), aioli (1:1), sour cream (1:1), avocado (1:1), hummus (1:1), white bean dip (1:1) for mayonnaise
Chicken, shrimp, tuna, crab, or spam for ham
Onion powder/dried minced onion (1 teaspoon) for onion
Any other cheese of choice (1:1), nutritional yeast, cashew cheese, commercial vegan cheddar for cheddar cheese
Veggie of choice for broccoli
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: The Best Monte Cristo Sliders
recipes.description: These sliders are the party version of the popular sandwich made with turkey, ham, Swiss, and powdered sugar. I’ve adjusted the recipe for maximum flavor to make these the best Monte Cristo Sliders ever!
ingredients: 12 pieces thinly sliced ham, about 6 ounces
12 pieces thinly sliced turkey, about 6 ounces
1/4 cup butter, melted, but slightly cooled
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees and place a piece of parchment paper in a 9×13 rectangle baking dish.

2. Cut the group of Hawaiian dinner rolls in half using a serrated knife so the tops are separated from the bottoms. Do not break the rolls apart into individual servings. You should have 2 large pieces of bread when you're done.
3. Mix mayonnaise and Dijon mustard together in a small bowl. Spread evenly over the top piece of bread.
4. Place 5 pieces of Swiss cheese on the bottom piece of bread, cutting one of the pieces in half to fit.
5. Layer sliced ham and sliced turkey on top of the Swiss cheese.
6. Top the meat with another 5 pieces of Swiss cheese, cutting one of the pieces in half to fit.
7. Place the tops of the rolls on the meat and cheese and carefully place all of the sliders in the baking dish.
8. Mix melted butter and eggs together in a small bowl. Brush the egg mixture over the rolls, making sure to get all of the tops coated.
9. Cover the baking pan with foil, tenting it so it doesn't touch the tops of the rolls, and bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

10. After 15 minutes, carefully remove the foil and re-brush the rolls with any egg mixture that has fallen off the sides. Bake uncovered for another 10-15 minutes until the rolls are golden brown and the egg mixture is cooked.
11. Allow the rolls to cool slightly and then dust with powdered sugar. Use a metal spatula to cut the sliders apart and serve with warmed raspberry jam.
substitutions: Any pre-packaged dinner rolls, homemade rolls, off brand Hawaiian rolls for King's Hawaiian Dinner Rolls
Aioli for mayonnaise
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Skillet Pancake
recipes.description: This Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Skillet Pancake is baked in a cast iron skillet and topped with a delicious cream cheese whipped cream. It’s a yummy festive breakfast that’s perfect for fall!
ingredients: additional pumpkin pie spice and cinnamon sticks, if desired
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
2. Add pancake mix, pumpkin puree, pumpkin pie spice, vanilla, and milk to a medium mixing bowl. Gently whisk until just combined. Do not overmix.

3. Pour the pancake batter into a lightly greased 10-inch cast iron skillet and top with chocolate chips. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the middle of the pancake comes out clean.
4. While the pancake is cooking, beat cream cheese for 2-3 minutes in a chilled medium mixing bowl until smooth.
5. Slowly add the heavy whipping cream until it's all combined with the cream cheese.
6. Continue beating on medium-high speed until soft peaks form.
7. Add powdered sugar and vanilla extract to the whipped cream and beat on medium-high speed until stiff peaks form (about 5-10 minutes). Refrigerate until ready to serve.
8. Slice the skillet pancake and serve with the cream cheese whipped cream and a dusting of pumpkin pie spice and a cinnamon stick, if desired.
substitutions: Water (1:1), non-dairy milk (1:1), evaporated milk (1:1) for milk
Cinnamon (3/4 teaspoon) + ginger, allspice, cloves, or nutmeg (1/4 teaspoon each) for pumpkin pie spice
Any flavor or size chocolate chips you want
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Cherry Chocolate Chip Muffins
recipes.description: These yummy Cherry Chocolate Chip Muffins are made with maraschino cherries and topped with a pretty pink glaze. They’re perfect for Valentine’s Day!
instructions: 1. Preheat your oven to 375 degrees.
2. Whisk egg, milk, and avocado oil together in a medium mixing bowl.
3. Stir flour, granulated sugar, baking powder, and salt into the wet ingredients just until moist.
4. Drain the jar of maraschino cherries, saving 3 tablespoons of the juice.
5. Chop the cherries into quarters and fold them into the batter along with chocolate chips.
6. Lightly grease a muffin tin and use a 1/4 measuring cup to add batter to each cup.
7. Bake the muffins for 18 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. Allow the muffins to cool for 10 minutes and then move from the pan to a wire rack.
9. Combine powdered sugar and reserved cherry juice to make the glaze. Start with 1 tablespoon of juice at a time until you reach the desired consistency.
10. Drizzle the glaze over the cooled muffins using a spoon or fork.
substitutions: Frozen whole cherries or fresh cherries for maraschino cherries
Regular sized chocolate chips for mini chocolate chips
Add half a cup of chopped pecans or walnuts if you want to add nuts
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Butterscotch Overnight Sticky Buns
recipes.description: These Butterscotch Overnight Sticky Buns are soft, pull-apart rolls covered in a delicious sugar glaze and topped with pecans. This yummy dish is perfect for any family gathering or holiday brunch.
ingredients: 16-18 frozen rolls, or 8 large rolls cut in half
1/2 cup pecan halves, or 1/4 cup chopped pecans
3.5 ounces butterscotch pudding and pie filling , not instant
instructions: 1. Grease a round 9-inch cake pan.
2. Spread pecan halves in the pan so the rounded sides are down.
3. Drop the rolls in the pan to form a single layer.
4. Blend butterscotch pudding, brown sugar, and cinnamon in a small bowl.
5. Sprinkle the mixture over the rolls.
6. Pour melted butter over the rolls.
7. Cover the pan with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.
8. When ready to cook, remove the plastic wrap, preheat your oven to 350 degrees.
9. Bake for 30 minutes or until sugar is well dissolved and bubbly. Check the rolls after 15 minutes and cover the top with foil if they are browning.
10. To serve, turn the sticky buns onto a large plate that will catch the syrup.
substitutions: Any frozen rolls
Chopped pecans for whole pecans
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Grape and Apple Chicken Salad
recipes.description: This grape and apple chicken salad is a quick and easy meal that features a creamy dressing, delicious fruit, savory chicken, and an extra special crunch. It’s the best chicken salad recipe ever!
instructions: 1. Add chicken, fruit, dried cranberries, and sliced almonds to a medium-size mixing bowl.
2. Stir mayonnaise with the rest of the ingredients and mix well to combine. Sprinkle salt and pepper to taste.
3. Create a sandwich with bread and 3/4 cup of the chicken salad.
substitutions: Chicken, shrimp, tuna, crab, or spam for chicken
Cashews, candied pecans, or no nuts in place of almonds
Greek yogurt for mayonnaise
Croissants, ciabatta rolls, wheat bread, lettuce leaves, sliced cucumbers for buns
Add celery for a crunch.
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Coconut Cilantro Chicken Soup
recipes.description: Coconut Cilantro Chicken Soup features a creamy broth, flavorful spices, shredded chicken, and white rice. This tasty soup is as easy to make as it is delicious!
ingredients: 1 cup shredded carrot, about 1 large carrot
15 ounces unsweetened lite coconut milk, 1 can
1/2 pound shredded and finely chopped chicken, about 2 cups
2 Tablespoons lime juice, about 1 fresh lime
instructions: 1. Add butter, shredded carrot, cinnamon, ginger, paprika, and salt to a large soup pot or dutch oven. Cook over medium-low heat until the carrots are soft and fragrant, then turn the heat to low.
2. Pulse chicken broth and cilantro in a blender 2-3 times until the cilantro has become fine and pour into the soup pot. Stir to combine.
3. Add coconut milk, chopped chicken, cooked white rice, lime juice, and soy sauce to the pot and stir to combine.
4. Simmer the soup on medium-low heat for 5-10 minutes until everything is warmed through. Serve with additional cilantro and lime wedges, if desired.
substitutions: Turkey or canned chicken for chicken
Vegetable stock, chicken bouillon, coconut milk for chicken broth
Parsley (1:1), Thai basil (1:1), lemon or lime (add to taste) for cilantro
Ghee (1:1); coconut oil (1:1), olive oil (3/4 of the amount of called for butter), margarine (1:1) for butter
Add 1/2 teaspoon curry powder
Add 1/4 teaspoon chili powder
Add chopped jalapeno
Add 1/2 teaspoon garam masala blend
Add 1 tablespoon Thai fish sauce
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Easy Chicken Enchiladas
recipes.description: These easy chicken enchiladas are made with shredded chicken, cheese, and a delicious enchilada sauce. They’re a simple and tasty dinner the whole family will love!
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
2. In a medium bowl, combine shredded chicken, salsa, sour cream, cumin, garlic powder, chili powder, and salt.

3. Spread 1/4 cup of the chicken mixture down the center of each tortilla and sprinkle with 1/4 cup of shredded cheese. Roll up the tortillas and place them seam side down in a greased 9×13 baking dish.
4. Pour enchilada sauce evenly over the top of the rolled tortillas and sprinkle with the remaining shredded cheese.
5. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
substitutions: Corn tortillas for flour tortillas
Monterey Jack, Pepper Jack, or Mexican blend cheese for cheddar cheese
Add black beans or corn to the chicken mixture
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: The Easiest Creamy Taco Soup
recipes.description: This delicious creamy taco soup features a creamy broth, ground beef, beans, vegetables, and plenty of taco spice. It’s so easy to make and ready in just 30 minutes!
instructions: 1. Brown ground beef in a large stockpot over medium-high heat until no longer pink. Drain off any fat.
2. Add crushed tomatoes, chicken broth, taco seasoning, pinto beans, black beans, and corn to the pot and stir to combine.
3. Bring the soup to a boil. Once it’s boiling, reduce heat to medium and simmer for 10 minutes.
4. Add cream cheese to a microwave safe bowl and heat for 30 seconds-1 minute. Stir well and then add to the soup. Allow it to melt for 2 minutes and whisk in any remaining cubes until combined.
5. Serve the soup with desired toppings.
substitutions: Ground turkey or leftover taco meat for ground beef
Kidney beans for pinto or black beans
Vegetable stock, chicken bouillon, coconut milk for chicken broth
Mascarpone, cottage cheese, Greek yogurt for cream cheese
Add 1 1/2 cups cooked rice or noodles after adding cream cheese
Suggested toppings: tortilla strips, shredded cheese, lime juice, chopped avocado, cilantro, and sour cream
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Melty Kalua Pork Sandwiches
recipes.description: If you’re a fan of the iconic plate lunch, you won’t want to miss these Melty Kalua Pork Sandwiches. This mouth-watering twist on a classic will transport you straight to the islands!
instructions: 1. Pat pork shoulder dry with paper towels and then pierce all over using a fork.
2. Place the pork in slow cooker and pour liquid smoke and Himalayan pink salt over the pork.
3. Cover and cook for 8-12 hours on low, or until the pork is cooked through.

4. Remove the pork from the slow cooker and discard all but 1 cup of liquid. Shred the pork and return to the slow cooker on the warm setting or keep in an airtight container until you're ready to make the sandwiches.
5. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit and lightly spray a 13 in x 18 in baking sheet.
6. Once the meat is ready, slice hoagie buns in half. Add 4-6 ounces of kalua pork to each hoagie and top with 2 slices of provolone cheese.

7. Place the open hoagies on the prepared baking sheet and toast at 350 degrees until the cheese has melted. (You may need to toast the sandwiches in batches if all of the hoagies don't fit on the baking sheet.)
8. Drizzle the sandwiches with katsu sauce, top with shredded cabbage, and serve.
substitutions: Swiss or colby jack for provolone
Red Hawaiian salt for Himalayan pink salt
Toast the bread for a crunch
Add pineapple rings on top of cheese for a sweet element
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Easy Crock Pot Minestrone Soup
recipes.description: This Crock Pot Minestrone Soup features tender vegetables, pasta, and beans in a flavorful seasoned broth. With a shorter ingredient list and the use of frozen vegetables, this will be the easiest minestrone soup you’ve ever made!
ingredients: 1 cup frozen chopped onions, about 1 small onion
2 cups frozen zucchini slices, about 2 medium zucchini
instructions: 1. Peel and slice carrots (or use frozen).
2. Place the carrots, onion, zucchini slices, minced garlic, kidney beans, beef broth, crushed tomatoes, basil, oregano, and salt and pepper in Crock Pot insert.
3. Stir well.
4. Cover and cook on high for 3-4 hours or low for 4-5 hours, until vegetables are tender.
5. With 30 minutes of cooking time left, add uncooked macaroni. Cover, turn the heat to high, and finish cooking until the macaroni is tender.
6. Serve with Parmesan cheese.
substitutions: Use fresh or frozen veggies
Any small pasta shapes (ditalini, shells, wagon wheels) for macaroni
Add sun-dried tomato pesto
Add chopped celery
Add bay leaves
Add potato cubes
Add dried rosemary
Add yellow squash cubes
Add Parmesan rind
Add frozen green beans
Add spinach
Add butternut squash
Add sweet potato cubes
Add cooked ground beef
Add seared cubes of chuck roast
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: The Easiest Creamy Chicken Noodle Soup
recipes.description: This Creamy Chicken Noodle Soup features a creamy broth, tender chicken, and savory vegetables. It’s incredibly easy to make and only has 8 ingredients!
ingredients: 2-3 boneless chicken breasts, trimmed of fat
instructions: 1. Bring water to a boil in a large stockpot.
2. Add chicken breasts and bouillon cubes to the water and reduce the heat to medium. Simmer for 15-20 minutes (time will depend on the thickness of chicken breasts).
3. Remove one chicken breast to ensure it has reached 165 degrees Fahrenheit. Carefully remove all of the chicken, shred it, and set aside.
4. Cook egg noodles in the chicken broth, adding up to a cup of water if needed.
5. When the noodles are done, add the shredded chicken, cream of chicken soup, evaporated milk, sour cream, frozen carrots, and frozen peas to the pot and stir well to combine.
6. Heat the soup until all the ingredients are warm.
substitutions: Cream of mushroom soup, cream of celery soup, cream of shrimp, Greek yogurt for cream of chicken soup
Powdered milk (mix 1 1/2 cups with 1 1/4 cups water), half and half (1:1), dairy free milks (1:1) for evaporated milk
Greek yogurt, cottage cheese, cream cheese, mascarpone cheese for sour cream
Add 1/2 pound fresh or canned mushrooms
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Easy Spaghetti with Chili Sauce (Cincinnati Chili)
recipes.description: Spaghetti with Chili Sauce (or Cincinnati Chili) features a meaty chili served over spaghetti and topped with sour cream and cheese. Yum!
instructions: 1. Cook and stir ground beef and onions in a large skillet or pan until beef is brown and onions are tender; drain off fat.
2. Stir in chili powder, salt, tomatoes, beans, and tomato sauce.
3. Cook uncovered over medium heat, about 10 minutes or until thickened.
4. While the chili sauce is simmering, cook the spaghetti as directed on package and drain.
5. Spoon chili over hot spaghetti.
6. Sprinkle each serving with cheddar cheese and a dollop of sour cream.
substitutions: Dried onions (3 Tablespoons) or onion powder (1 teaspoon) for fresh onion
Ground turkey for ground beef
Black beans, pinto beans, navy beans, cannellini beans, or beans of choice for kidney beans
Tomato paste (1 part paste to 1 part water), canned tomatoes (1:1), tomato soup (remove 1/4 cup liquid for every 10.75 ounce can), spaghetti sauce (1:1) for tomato sauce
Instead of one can whole tomatoes, try 2 cans diced tomatoes for already broken up tomatoes and to stretch the sauce
To increase the spice factor, add two more teaspoons of chili powder and a shake or so of crushed red pepper
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Easy Spam Fried Rice
recipes.description: This Spam Fried Rice recipe features the delicious canned meat mixed with rice, vegetables, and a salty sauce. It's an easy side dish and a great way to use up leftover rice!
ingredients: 1 cup uncooked long-grain rice, or 3 cups of cooked rice
instructions: 1. Cook rice or measure out leftover cooked rice.
2. While the rice is cooking, dice Spam. Fry in a medium frying pan over medium heat until brown and crispy.
3. While the Spam is cooking, place mixed peas and carrots in a microwave-safe dish and cover with water. Cover and microwave on high for 2 minutes.
4. Drain the vegetables and add them to the frying pan.

5. Push the meat and vegetables to the side of the pan. Lightly beat eggs and add them to the frying pan. Push the eggs around until they start to cook and then mix them with the meat and vegetables. Cook the eggs for 2-3 more minutes.
6. When the eggs are cooked, add the cooked rice, soy sauce, vinegar, and sesame oil to the frying pan.
7. Stir everything together until mixed well. Turn the heat to low and continue warming until the rice is heated through.
substitutions: You can use leftover rice for this recipe
Try adding different flavors like: minced garlic, frozen corn, fish sauce, oyster sauce, green onion
Try different Spam flavors like: original, low sodium, or teriyaki
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Elevated Hamburger Helper Lasagna (One Pot)
recipes.description: This elevated Hamburger Helper Lasagna combines the noodles from the familiar boxed dinner with a homemade meat sauce and 2 different kinds of cheese. It's a delicious one pot lasagna meal that's so easy to throw together!
ingredients: 2 boxes Hamburger Helper Lasagna, 6.9 ounces each
instructions: 1. Add ground beef and minced garlic to a dutch oven or large soup pot. Brown ground beef and garlic over medium-high heat.
2. Once the ground beef is cooked, drain off any excess oil. Add tomato paste, diced tomatoes, salt, pepper, and oregano to the pot. Stir to combine.
3. Cover the pan and simmer for 10 minutes.
4. Add 2 packages of Hamburger Helper Lasagna noodles (not the seasoning) and chicken broth or water to the meat mixture. Bring to a boil.
5. Once the mixture is boiling, reduce to a simmer. Cover and cook for 10 minutes, or until the noodles are al dente.
6. Reduce the heat to low. Add cream cheese and 1 cup of shredded mozzarella to the noodles. Stir until the cheeses have melted.
7. Top with an additional 1/2 cup of mozzarella cheese and parsley before serving.
substitutions: Use any noodle shape you'd like in place of hamburger helper noodles
Swap ricotta or cottage cheese (8 oz) for cream cheese with 1 cup mozzarella
24 oz jar of favorite pasta sauce in place of tomatoes and seasonings
Tomato sauce or tomato puree (2-3 T. to 1 T. paste), diced/crushed tomatoes (2 T. to 1 T. paste), pureed red peppers, ketchup (1:1) for tomato paste
Marjoram, thyme, Italian seasoning, basil, parsley, tarragon, Mexican oregano (1:1) for oregano
Vegetable stock, chicken bouillon, chicken stock, coconut milk for chicken broth
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Simple Crock Pot Hamburger Stew
recipes.description: This simple Crock Pot Hamburger Stew features browned hamburger, potatoes, carrots, peas, and onions and is a cinch to throw together!
ingredients: 1 pound baby carrots, chopped if desired
instructions: 1. Brown ground beef in a frying pan until no longer pink. Drain and set aside.
2. While the ground beef is cooking, chop onion into small pieces and peel and slice potatoes into half circles.
3. Layer potatoes, chopped onion, and baby carrots in Crock Pot, seasoning each layer with salt and pepper.
4. Pour tomato soup, beef broth, and Worcestershire sauce over the vegetables in the Crock Pot.
5. Add ground beef on top of the vegetables and stir everything to combine.
6. Cover and cook on low for 5 to 6 hours or on high for 3 to 4 hours.
7. Once the vegetables are soft, remove the lid and add frozen peas. Stir to combine, turn the Crock Pot to warm and allow the peas to defrost.
8. Serve immediately.
substitutions: Adjust cooking times according to your Crock Pot capabilities
Ground turkey for ground beef
Slice 2-3 medium carrots into 1-inch pieces in place of baby carrots
Add 1 cup beef broth after cooking if desired
Beef stock, beef consomme, chicken broth, vegetable broth, mushroom broth, beef bouillon for beef broth
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Poppy Seed Chicken Casserole with Rice
recipes.description: Poppy Seed Chicken Casserole with Rice features a creamy chicken and rice mixture covered with a delicious crunchy Ritz cracker topping. It's an easy way to use up leftovers and is sure to become a family favorite dinner!
ingredients: 2 cooked and shredded chicken breasts, about 3 cups
10.5 ounces canned cream of chicken soup
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly coat a 9×13 baking dish with cooking spray and set aside.
2. In a medium-sized bowl, mix shredded chicken, cream of chicken soup, sour cream, and cooked rice.
3. Mix crushed Ritz crackers, melted butter, poppy seeds, dried parsley, and grated Parmesan cheese in a small bowl.
4. Pour the chicken mixture into the greased pan and spread into an even layer. Top with cracker crumb mixture.
5. Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until topping is crispy and the chicken mixture is bubbling.
substitutions: Use plain Greek yogurt instead of sour cream.
Add in some softened cream cheese in place of some of the sour cream.
Add in cooked peas or broccoli to the chicken mixture.
Omit the rice and serve over cooked egg noodles or mashed potatoes.
Use leftover turkey, pork, or canned chicken instead of chicken.
Mix in Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, lemon juice, or pepper to the chicken mixture.
Cream of mushroom soup, cream of celery soup, cream of shrimp, Greek yogurt for cream of chicken soup
Ghee (1:1); coconut oil (1:1), olive oil (3/4 of the amount of called for butter), margarine (1:1) for butter
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: The Best 3 Ingredient Crock Pot Pork Chops
recipes.description: These 3 Ingredient Crock Pot Pork Chops are incredibly tender, flavorful, and so easy to make. As the name suggests, you'll only need three ingredients to make this delicious dinner!
ingredients: 10.75 ounces cream of chicken soup (1 can)
12 ounces cooked egg noodles or rice
instructions: 1. Brown pork chops in a greased frying pan over medium heat. (You’re not cooking the chops through, but rather searing each side briefly for extra flavor.)
2. Sprinkle each pork chop with some salt and pepper and place them in the Crock Pot.
3. Pour cream of chicken soup over the pork chops and cover with the lid.
4. Cook on LOW for 6-8 hours until pork is no longer pink.
5. Serve pork chops and gravy over cooked egg noodles or rice.
substitutions: Cream of mushroom soup, cream of celery soup, cream of shrimp, Greek yogurt for cream of chicken soup
Use an extra can of soup to make more gravy
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Crock Pot Rosemary Pork Chops
recipes.description: These Rosemary Pork Chops have all of the flavors of a Sunday dinner without all of the work! A creamy mushroom and rosemary sauce cover tender pork chops and red potatoes in this easy Crock Pot recipe.
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds petite red potatoes, or about 8 medium red potatoes
10 ounces canned cream of mushroom soup
instructions: 1. Brown pork chops in a lightly greased frying pan over medium heat, about 2 minutes on each side. (You’re not cooking the meat through, but rather searing each side briefly for extra flavor.)
2. While the pork chops are browning, wash and cut each red potato in half.
3. Place the potatoes on the bottom of the slow cooker and then place the pork chops on top of the potatoes.
4. Sprinkle the pork chops with dried rosemary, dried chopped onion, salt, and pepper.
5. Mix cream of mushroom soup, Worcestershire sauce, and mushrooms with the juice in a small bowl.
6. Pour the soup mixture over the pork chops.
7. Cover and cook on LOW for 4-6 hours, or until meat and potatoes are cooked through.
substitutions: Adjust cooking times according to your Crock Pot capabilities
Skip browning pork chops if in a rush
Dried minced onion (2 T.) or onion powder (1 T.) in place of onion flakes
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Crock Pot Country Style Pork Ribs (3 ingredients)
recipes.description: You'll only need 3 ingredients to make these tender Crock Pot Country Style Pork Ribs. They're perfectly saucy and delicious, and couldn't be easier to throw together!
ingredients: 3-4 pounds country style pork ribs, boneless
instructions: 1. Sprinkle ribs with salt and pepper and place on a foil-lined baking sheet.
2. Broil ribs in oven on low until browned, turning every 5 minutes.
3. Put sliced onion in the bottom of the Crock Pot followed by the ribs.
4. Pour barbecue sauce over the ribs. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high for 4-5 hours.
5. Serve ribs with rice, mashed potatoes, or pasta.
substitutions: Use country style ribs instead of a large rack of ribs
You can skip the broiler altogether and just brown the sides in a frying pan, but this will take longer
Add a little flavor and tenderizer to the meat by pouring in a can of Coke with the barbecue sauce
Adjust cooking times according to your Crock Pot capabilities
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Healthy Turkey Lasagna Soup
recipes.description: This healthy Turkey Lasagna Soup recipe features browned ground turkey, tender noodles, a flavorful broth, and a little cheese. It’s everything you love about traditional lasagna without all of the calories!
ingredients: Shredded mozzarella and grated parmesan, to taste
instructions: 1. Brown ground turkey in a large soup pot until no longer pink and all of the liquid has cooked off.
2. Stir in onion powder, minced garlic, oregano, red pepper flakes, basil, and tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.
3. Add crushed tomatoes, basil, and chicken broth. Bring the soup to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 20-30 minutes.
4. With 7-8 minutes left, add the broken lasagna noodles to the pot and cook until al dente.
5. When noodles are done cooking, season the soup with salt and pepper, to taste.
6. Top each serving with shredded mozzarella or grated parmesan.
substitutions: Bowtie, penne, macaroni, or rotini for lasagna noodles
1:1 substitute of basil, italian seasoning, thyme, or marjoram for oregano
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: Sweet and Sticky Chex Mix
recipes.description: Sticky Chex Mix features two different kinds of cereal and almonds covered in a delicious sugar syrup. It's sweet, crunchy, totally addicting, and the perfect holiday treat!
instructions: 1. Combine Rice Chex and Corn Chex in a large bowl and set aside.
2. Add corn syrup, granulated sugar, and margarine to a medium saucepan and bring to a boil.
3. Boil for 2 minutes (set a timer).
4. Remove the syrup from the heat and add vanilla. Pour the syrup over the cereal and stir to make sure everything is coated.
5. Pour the cereal onto large metal baking sheets. Add sliced almonds and mix everything together.
6. Allow the Chex mix to cool. Store in airtight containers.
substitutions: Spray bowl with cooking spray
Use a wooden spoon sprayed with cooking spray to mix
Butter for margarine (1:1)
Try these mix-ins: shredded coconut, pecans, walnuts, cashews, peanuts, golden graham cereal, popcorn, pretzels, chocolate chips, and holiday M&M's
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table

recipes.name: No Bake Birds Nest Cookies
recipes.description: These No Bake Birds Nest Cookies are a healthier and holiday version of the classic treat. Your friends and family will love munching on these fun Easter nest desserts decorated with candy eggs!
ingredients: 48 coated candy eggs, Cadbury mini eggs are my favorite
instructions: Add peanut butter, honey, salt, and butter to a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir well until the butter has melted and the mixture is smooth.
Add oats, vanilla extract, and cocoa powder to a large mixing bowl. Pour the peanut butter mixture in and mix everything together until combined.

Using a large spoon, drop tablespoon-size balls on a parchment-lined sheet pan. Spray a rounded handle with non-stick spray and make a well in the center, pressing the edges all around to form a circle.
Place the cookies in the refrigerator for 20-30 minutes until cool. Add 3 coated candy eggs to each nest before serving.
substitutions: Use any kind of nut or seed butter
Make them smaller if desired
Use whatever oats you have on hand
recipes.creator: The Ashcroft Family Table
